remarks: This version of ~ dfsb7 does not require that ` ph ` and ` z ` be distinct.  This permits it to be used as a definition for substitution in a formalization that omits the logically redundant axiom ~ ax-5 i.e. that doesn't have the concept of a variable not occurring in a wff. ( ~ df-sb is also suitable, but its mixing of free and bound variables is distasteful to some logicians.)  (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2016.)
statement:
sb7f.1 $e |- F/ z ph $.
sb7f $p |- ( [ y / x ] ph <-> E. z ( z = y /\ E. x ( x = z /\ ph ) ) ) $.
$d y z $.
